results.title: Alex Murdaugh Convicted of Murdering Wife and Son
results.abstract: The verdict came less than three hours after jurors began deliberating. It followed a six-week trial that served as a reckoning for Mr. Murdaugh, a lawyer whose life unraveled in recent years.

results.byline: By Ben Shpigel and Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
results.title: 5 Key Takeaways From the Murdaugh Murders Trial
results.abstract: The jury convicted Alex Murdaugh, a prominent South Carolina lawyer, of murdering his wife and son, and he was sentenced to life in prison.

media.caption: Alex Murdaugh arriving at the courthouse in Walterboro, S.C., for closing arguments on Thursday.

results.title: Why Alex Murdaugh’s Quick Conviction Worries Me

results.title: Lesion Removed During Biden’s Physical Was Cancerous
results.abstract: President Biden’s physician said that the lesion was basal cell carcinoma, a common and relatively unaggressive form of skin cancer, and that no further treatment was needed.

media.caption: The site of President Biden’s biopsy has “healed nicely,” his doctor said.

results.title: Why Russia Is Taking Thousands of Ukrainian Children
results.abstract: The story of one girl who ended up in a Russian foster family shows the damage done by this mass transfer, which is part of a vast propaganda campaign.

results.adx_keywords: Whiskey;Factories and Manufacturing;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Alcoholic Beverages;Home Repairs and Improvements;Bourbon (Whiskey);Jack Daniel Distillery (Lynchburg, Tenn);Tennessee
results.title: Whiskey Fungus Fed by Jack Daniel’s Encrusts a Tennessee Town
results.abstract: The dark growth, fed by alcohol vapors from barrels of aging Jack Daniel’s whiskey, has coated homes, cars, patio furniture and road signs in a sooty crust, residents said. One woman is suing Lincoln County.

media.caption: Whiskey fungus on tree branches in Lincoln County, Tenn. Residents have been complaining about the ethanol-fueled fungus from a Jack Daniel’s distillery in neighboring Moore County.

results.title: More Doctors Can Now Prescribe a Key Opioid Treatment. Will It Help?
results.abstract: The federal government loosened regulations for buprenorphine, but health experts warn that entrenched problems around training and access could stall efforts to get people the medication.

media.caption: For over a decade, Randall Lambert has used buprenorphine, which has eased his opioid cravings as he managed an otherwise chaotic life.
